intro: Ouratea bipartita, commonly known as the two-part Ouratea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Ochnaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves that are divided into two lobes. The plant produces small, white or yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds. It is often found in lowland forests and is valued for its ornamental foliage.
